Sentencas: A topology optimization method is used to identify the optimal shape of the nano-composite cathode of a solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC).
Titulo: A 2D model for shape optimization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: A simplified analysis model is used in computations aimed at reducing ohmic losses by optimizing the shape of the cathode to minimize resistance.
Titulo: A 2D model for shape optimization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: The model of the SOFC is reduced to a periodic, 2D conduction problem with design-dependent ionic transfer boundary conditions.
Titulo: A 2D model for shape optimization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: Special techniques are introduced to avoid physically inadmissible designs that would otherwise be allowed by the 2D model.
Titulo: A 2D model for shape optimization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: Isoperimetric constraints on the perimeter and the amount of material are used in the problem.
Titulo: A 2D model for shape optimization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: Numerical examples are provided to discuss the effect of material properties and the resource restrictions introduced by the constraints.
Titulo: A 2D model for shape optimization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes

Sentencas: The methodology discussed can be applied to similar problems involving design-dependent boundary conditions.
Titulo: A 2D model for shape optimization of solid oxide fuel cell cathodes
